## Logistic Regression - an example
```{r eval=FALSE}
library(IntroToRforActuaries)
data(NFL)
NFL = subset(NFL, Home==TRUE)
plot(jitter(NFL$TODiff), jitter(NFL$Win, factor=0.5), xlab="Turnover difference", ylab = "Wins")
```

## Logistic Regression - an example
```{r echo=FALSE}
library(IntroToRforActuaries)
data(NFL)
NFL = subset(NFL, Home==TRUE)
plot(jitter(NFL$TODiff), jitter(NFL$Win, factor=0.5), xlab="Turnover difference", ylab = "Wins")
```

##

```{r }
fit = glm(Win ~ TODiff, family=binomial(link="logit"), data=NFL)
library(boot)
plot(jitter(NFL$TODiff), jitter(NFL$Win, factor=0.5), xlab="Turnover difference", ylab = "Wins")
curve(inv.logit(coef(fit)[1] + coef(fit)[2]*x), add=TRUE)
abline(h=0.5)
```
